title: Citi Dominican Republic Ranks #1 Among Finance Ministry's Market Creators
summary: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic - This month, the Ministry of Finance's General Office of Public Credit presented the 2012 rankings for its Market Creator Program. Citi Dominican Republic and Citinversiones ranked #1 and #4, respectively.
tag-1: Citi Dominican Republic Ranks #1 Among Finance Ministry's Market Creators
tag-2: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic – This month, the Ministry of Finance's General Office of Public Credit presented the 2012 rankings for its Market Creator Program. Citi Dominican Republic and Citinversiones ranked #1 and #4, respectively.
tag-3: The Market Creator Program is a cooperative effort between the General Office of Public Credit and financial institutions to facilitate the placement and increase the trading volume of public debt securities. "This important position in the Market Creator rankings reflects our commitment to the development of the Dominican Republic's capital market," commented Ramón Hasbun, Markets and Treasury Director at Citi Dominican Republic.
tag-4: The Ministry of Finance's definition of market creators includes banks, stock traders, stock brokers, savings and loan associations and any other entity authorized by the General Office of Public Credit and designated via a ratings and classification system to carry out the commercialization, daily pricing and authorized trading of public debt securities, with the goal of developing the secondary market in such securities.
tag-5: The Ministry of Finance rankings take into consideration participation in primary market bidding, volume of transactions in the secondary market and screen presence on the Bloomberg financial platform.
tag-6: "We are very proud to participate in this market and to offer liquidity and transparency to our local and international clients," commented Máximo Vidal, General Manager, Citi Dominican Republic.
